Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class PaymentHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.PaymentHandler
public final class PaymentHandler
extends java.lang.Object
This is a final class whose methods are used when a player has to pay something like a development card or a set of productions.

      public PaymentHandler()

  • Method Details

    • performPayment

      public static void performPayment​(Warehouse warehouse, java.util.Map<ResourceSource,​java.util.EnumMap<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> howToTakeResources, Turn turn) throws DepotOutOfBoundsException, DepotNotFoundException, StrongboxOutOfBoundException, PaymentErrorException
      Main method of the class. Starting from instructions sent by player, it checks whether they are compatible with player's warehouse. If all checks are passed, the payment is performed as required.
      Parameters:
      warehouse - player warehouse from which resources have to be taken.
      howToTakeResources - instructions sent by client side.
      turn - turn in which the player is trying to do the payment.
      Throws:
      PaymentErrorException - if at least one check fails.
      DepotOutOfBoundsException
      DepotNotFoundException
      StrongboxOutOfBoundException

    • checkResourcesFromNormalDepots

      private static boolean checkResourcesFromNormalDepots​(Warehouse warehouse, java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
      This method ensures that for each resource type, there is a normal depot with the required occurrences.
      Parameters:
      warehouse - warehouse involved into the check.
      resources - map that specifies for each resource type how many occurrences are required.
      Returns:
      the result of the check
      See Also:
      Warehouse

    • checkResourcesFromStrongBox

      private static boolean checkResourcesFromStrongBox​(Warehouse warehouse, java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
      This method ensures that for each resource type the strongbox has a number of occurrences type compatible with what is required.
      Parameters:
      warehouse - warehouse involved into the check.
      resources - map that specifies for each resource type how many occurrences are required.
      Returns:
      the result of the check.
      See Also:
      Warehouse

    • takeResourcesFromNormalDepots

      private static void takeResourcesFromNormalDepots​(Warehouse warehouse, java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources) throws DepotNotFoundException, DepotOutOfBoundsException
      For each resource type picks required occurrences from a normal depot, see Warehouse for further details.
      Parameters:
      warehouse - player warehouse from which retrieve resources.
      resources - that have to be taken from normal depots.
      Throws:
      DepotNotFoundException
      DepotOutOfBoundsException

    • takeResourcesFromExtraDepots

      private static void takeResourcesFromExtraDepots​(Warehouse warehouse, java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> resources) throws DepotOutOfBoundsException, DepotNotFoundException
      Takes resources from extra depots, see Warehouse for further details.
      Parameters:
      warehouse - player warehouse from which retrieve resources.
      resources - that have to be taken from the extra depots.
      Throws:
      DepotOutOfBoundsException
      DepotNotFoundException

      Parameters:

    • checkCostCoherence

    • areValidInstructions

      public static boolean areValidInstructions​(java.util.Map<ResourceSource,​java.util.EnumMap<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> howToTakeResources)
      Boolean method that ensures that instructions given client side are correct.
      Parameters:
      howToTakeResources - map of maps that establish from where and how much resources the player wants to take from his normal depots, strongbox and extra depots.
      Returns:
      the result of the check

    • convertResource

      private static java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> convertResource​(java.util.Map<ResourceSource,​java.util.EnumMap<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> howToTakeResources)
      Converts the input in a map that for each type of resource specifies the number of occurrences needed to perform an action.
      Parameters:
      howToTakeResources - map of maps that establish from where and how much resources the player wants to take from his normal depots, strongbox and extra depots.
      Returns:
      resulting map
